intro: Clutia pulchella f. obtusata, commonly known as the broadleaf clutia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its smooth, oval-shaped leaves that are typically broader than those of the typical variety. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, adding a delicate appearance to its foliage. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. The f. obtusata form is distinguished by its more rounded leaf margins, making it a notable cultivar in horticultural collections.
